title: Car-Parts Supplier Continental to Overhaul Business
text:
BERLIN—Continental AG, one of the world’s biggest auto-parts suppliers, said it would reorganize its business and book a €2.5 billion ($2.8 billion) write-down, in the latest evidence of how softening global car demand and the mass shift to electric vehicles are reshaping the car-manufacturing economy.

In a sign that it expects the industry’s current travails to continue, Continental said it had shelved plans for a partial initial public offering of stock in its powertrain division—home to most of its legacy, pre-electric...
description: The company plans to book a $2.8 billion write-down in the latest evidence of how softening global car demand and the mass shift to electric vehicles are reshaping the economy of car manufacturing.
